widgets_values: Validation sampling settings are set here for all the sampler nodes.
describe the image in 40 words and 2 sentences

本工作流集合整理自
葫芦娃（https://github.com/chflame163/ComfyUI_LayerStyle）
和kijai（https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-FluxTrainer/tree/3c3121915fe1e49b86891d25119f13cbd6712189）
学习交流微信：ZhiWenDesign

可以在Comfy中实现一站式训练集打标和训练Lora,其中1234为训练集反推打标，56789101112为lora训练

使用前步骤：
1、先关闭下面一排5-12节点，用上方1-4节点进行训练集处理，设置好输入和输出目录，
2、打标运行完成后，关闭1234节点，开启5-12节点进行lora训练。

对于多分辨率训练，请输入具有不同数据集分辨率的相同源目录。据我所知，Flux喜欢多种分辨率。
对于单分辨率训练，只需添加单个数据集即可。

地址填写自己的本地训练集地址即可。
您可以使用与在 Comfy 中进行推理相同的模型。当启用fp8 base 时，模型在初始化时向下转换为 torch.float e4m3fn，这意味着如果您在此处加载 fp8 模型，它也应该具有相同的格式。

Nuckyduck:

Use the train Dataset to incorporate your images. I haven't tried higher than 512 base with 1024 max upscale. You can try for higher/less depending on your total vram. 

Under flux model I would recommend using flux1-dev-fp8.

I haven't messed around with the optimizer. You can try cosine restart if you're brave.

**IMPORTANT** You need to use 'split mode' if you want to train on lower than 24gb vram. Even at 16GB, not using split mode gives terrible and slow results. You can try without it but YMMV.

For network dim/alpha, were going to use 64. 86 gives good results for more detailed loras but I wouldn't use it if you're just training a face, as 64 seems more than good enough.

For max train steps, I use 1500 but you might be able to get away with less using better images.

I use bf16 as save type.

Nuckyduck:

Use the switches on the right to control what nodes are active.

Use 1-4 to process your data.

Load your image directory from the string in box one. From there, choose if you want to use a locally hosted LM or WD14 tagger to tag your images. From there, use any forced tag (I used my name) as main tag and it will add to those tags.

Use 'right click' -> Bypass to skip a node, such as the tagger you are not using.

Note: I got the best results just using my name as the tag with nothing else. No 1boy, solo, whatever. 

4 Will save your processed images to a folder. I recommend using an output folder to keep your preprocessed and original images separate.

Then turn 1-4 off and turn 5-12 on and continue to train.

This workflow is adapted from the original one here, mostly with personal changes. All credit goes to https://openart.ai/workflows/kaka/flux-lora-training-in-comfyui/mhY7UndLNPLEGNGiy7kJ
